page.title: 16MR. P. PALMER OF SHEPPERDINE
page.content: We interviewed Mr. Palmer who has been the lighthouse keeper at Shepperdine for 63 years. He told us quite a lot of stories about the area we live in and the boats that sailed up the Severn. Mr. Palmer was brought up in Berkely and came to Shepperdine in 1922. He came to his house 7 years later. Mr. Palmer is very contented working in his lighthouse. The main transport up and down the Severn bank was by horse and cart. Mr. Palmer's grandfather was a river pilot. On October l5th l955 at Shepperdine, Mr. Palmer advised the pilots of the Norwegian timber boat Sagner-bratt to ground her on the mud flats because of thick fog. We saw a photograph of the scene. The same morning at 4.30 a.m. Mr. Palmer direct 12 ships to came aground because of fog and most of them were
